name: 智慧型人形機器人
goals: Understand fundamentals of human and humanoid robotics walking
Use of programming to simulate and analyze complex control problems that arise in the area of humanoid robotics
Evaluate performance of several push recovery methods.
syllabus:
Week 1: Basic control theory: Servo motors, PID control  
Week 2: Homogeneous coordinates, affine transformations in 2D and 3D.  
Week 3: Kinematics for Humanoid Robots:  
Week 4: Forward and inverse kinematics of humanoid robots. Denavit-Hartenberg convention  
and similar approaches.  
Week 5: Human locomotion: walking, jogging, running. Static and dynamically stable motions.  
Week 6: Dynamics of locomotion: Inverted pendulum models.  
Week 7: Walking gait generation using open loop control: Keyframe animation, cyclical pattern  
generators (CPG), parameterized motions, zero moment point (ZMP) control,  
Week 8: Sensors for humanoid robots: accelerometers, gyroscopes, and force sensors.  
Week 9: Midterm  
Week 10: Feedback control and active balancing: centre of mass (CoM) and centre of pressure  
(CoP) based approaches.  
Week 11: Walking on uneven surfaces.  
Week 12:Push recovery: footstep planning and adaptation, and capture steps.  
Week 13: Motion planning: complex motion planning for humanoid robots. Quadtree  
decomposition. Rapidly exploring random trees (RRT) planning.  
Week 14: Computer vision for humanoid robots: image processing, colour models,  
Week 15: Filter cascades  
Week 16: Optical flow analysis,  
Week 17: Ego-motion estimation, visual servoing  
Week 18: Final Exam
prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
